marketNews.title: The Fed Cuts Rates by 25 Bps, Projects 2 More Cuts by End of 2025
marketNews.content: The US central bank, The Fed, on Wednesday (17/9) local time decided to cut interest rates by 25 bps to the range of 4-4.25%, in line with consensus expectations, marking its first rate cut this year. In a post-meeting press conference, Fed Chair Jerome Powell said this step was taken due to recent data showing increasing signs of a weakening US labor market. Nevertheless, Powell emphasized that this decision is not without risk, given that US inflation remains high while the labor market is weakening. Besides the rate cut, The Fed also updated its economic projections for 2025 and 2026, here are the details: The Fed Funds Rate is expected to drop to the range of 3.5-3.75% in 2025, more than the projection in June 2025 in the range of 3.75-4%. This latest projection from The Fed is in line with market expectations based on analysis from the CME FedWatch Tool. For 2026, The Fed projects an additional rate cut of 25 bps, the same as the June 2025 projection. The Fed increased its US economic growth projection, with GDP expected to grow by +1.6% in 2025, +1.8% in 2026, and +1.9% in 2027. For comparison, in June 2025, The Fed expected US economic growth to reach only +1.4% in 2025, +1.6% in 2026, and +1.8% in 2027. The Fed expects core inflation to be 3.1% in 2025, unchanged from the June 2025 projection. Core inflation is expected to decrease to 2.6% in 2026, slightly higher than the June 2025 estimate of 2.4%, before reaching 2.1% in 2027. The Fed also forecasts the unemployment rate to rise to 4.5% in 2025, the same as the June 2025 projection. The unemployment rate is expected to fall to 4.4% in 2026 and 4.3% in 2027. The US financial market tended to be muted and moved mixed following The Fed's decision and Powell's comments, with the DJIA strengthening by +0.57% on Wednesday (17/9) while the S&P 500 and Nasdaq fell by -0.10% and -0.32% respectively. On the same day, the US dollar index (DXY) rose +0.25% to the level of ~96.9, while the 10-year US government bond yield increased by +5.9 bps to the level of 4.087%. CIO of SieberNXT, Mark Malek, told Reuters that the market reaction reflected profit taking (sell on news) over the news of The Fed's rate cut.

marketNews.title: Key Takeaway
marketNews.content: We see uncertainty from the external side gradually subsiding as The Fed's rate-cutting cycle begins, following the completion of most trade agreements related to reciprocal US tariffs. Thus, investors can focus more on domestic issues such as the execution/initiative of government programs and the acceleration of state budget spending to boost economic growth again.

marketNews.title: Other Hot Topics You Need to Know...
marketNews.content: The DPR on Thursday (18/9) approved the government's revised State Budget Draft (RAPBN) for 2026, with the deficit target increasing to 2.68% of GDP, compared to 2.48% of GDP in the initial draft. The DPR also approved revisions to revenue and expenditure targets for the 2026 RAPBN, with the state revenue target rising from 3,147.7 trillion rupiah to 3,153.6 trillion rupiah (+10% YoY from the 2025 outlook), the state expenditure target rising from 3,786.5 trillion rupiah to 3,842.7 trillion rupiah (+8.9% YoY from the 2025 outlook), central government spending rising from 3,136.5 trillion rupiah to 3,149.7 trillion rupiah (+18.3% YoY from the 2025 outlook), and fund transfers to regions rising from 650 trillion rupiah to 693 trillion rupiah (-19.8% YoY from the 2025 outlook). Finance Minister Purbaya Yudhi Sadewa reiterated his commitment to keeping the budget deficit below 3% of GDP next year. Bloomberg reported that Danantara has approved Balagopal Kunduvara, currently the vice president of the financial services division at Singapore Airlines Ltd., as the new finance director at Garuda Indonesia ($GIAA). Bloomberg sources mentioned that Kunduvara's appointment is GIAA's effort to improve its balance sheet and expand its international network. Kunduvara will replace Prasetio, who was dismissed from the position of finance director and risk management of GIAA in the Extraordinary General Meeting of Shareholders (RUPSLB) in June 2025. Bloomberg sources mentioned that Kunduvara is scheduled to start working at GIAA in October 2025. Representatives from GIAA, Danantara, and Kunduvara have not commented on this news, while a spokesperson for Singapore Airlines declined to comment. The Indonesia Stock Exchange (IDX) decided to temporarily halt the trading of Koka Indonesia ($KOKA) securities in the regular and cash markets starting from the pre-opening session on September 18, 2025. This step was taken by the IDX because KOKA's controller had violated the commitment to maintain control, as disclosed in the company's prospectus in September 2023. Based on the company's prospectus, Gao Jing, as the beneficial owner and controller of the company, stated that he would remain the beneficial owner and controller of the company for a period of at least 5 years after the registration statement became effective. Sumber Mas Konstruksi ($SMKM) announced that Lim Shrimp Org Pte. Ltd. plans to acquire up to 44.98% of SMKM shares from PT Vina Nauli Jordania, the controller. This transaction plan is still in the negotiation stage, so the transaction value is unknown. Upon completion of this planned transaction, Lim Shrimp Org Pte. Ltd. will carry out a mandatory tender offer. Harta Djaya Karya ($MEJA) announced that PT Bisnis Bersama Berkah and PT Triple Berkah Bersama plan to acquire 45% of MEJA shares from Richie Adrian Hartanto S. and PT Interra Djaya Karya. Upon completion of this transaction, PT Bisnis Bersama Berkah and PT Triple Berkah Bersama will become the new controllers of MEJA and will conduct a mandatory tender offer. This transaction plan is still in the negotiation stage, so the transaction value and completion date are unknown.

tickerNews.title: ITMG Plans Share Buyback Up to IDR 2.49 Trillion
tickerNews.content: Indo Tambangraya Megah ($ITMG) announced a plan for a share buyback of up to 10% of its total issued capital with a fund allocation of up to 2.49 trillion rupiah during the period of November 4, 2025, to November 4, 2026. This plan will be discussed at the AGM on November 3, 2025.

tickerNews.title: GoTo Secures IDR 4.65 Trillion Term Loan Facility
tickerNews.content: GoTo Gojek Tokopedia ($GOTO) obtained a term loan facility with a 4-year tenor amounting to 4.65 trillion rupiah from Bank DBS Indonesia and UOB. These funds will be used by GOTO to repay the remaining loan based on the facility agreed upon in November 2022, with an outstanding balance of 467 billion rupiah as of June 2025, as well as for general corporate purposes, investment, and working capital needs.

tickerNews.title: HEXA Shareholders Approve 2024 Dividend Payout of USD 21.7 Million
tickerNews.content: Shareholders of Hexindo Adiperkasa ($HEXA) approved the plan to distribute dividends for the 2024 fiscal year amounting to USD 21.7 million or USD 0.02588 per share, equivalent to approximately 427 rupiah per share assuming an exchange rate of 16,505 rupiah per US dollar. This amount indicates a dividend yield of ~7.9% based on HEXA's stock price at the market close on Thursday (18/9) of 5,375 rupiah per share. The cum date in the regular and negotiation market is September 24, 2025, with payment on October 17, 2025.

tickerNews.title: HGII Considers Expansion into Waste-to-Energy Sector
tickerNews.content: The President Director of Hero Global Investment ($HGII), Robin Sunyoto, stated that his company is considering options for expansion into the waste-to-energy sector, which is expected to strengthen the company's business portfolio and open opportunities for sustainable revenue growth. Robin mentioned that this consideration is currently in the internal discussion stage.

tickerNews.title: GMFI Plans Rights Issue of Nearly 124 Billion New Shares, API to Absorb Rights via Land Inbreng
tickerNews.content: Garuda Maintenance Facility Aero Asia ($GMFI) plans to execute a rights issue of up to ~124 billion new shares with a dilution effect of up to 76.79%. The exercise price has not been announced, while the proceeds from this corporate action are intended for the development of capabilities and flight maintenance operations. Garuda Indonesia ($GIAA), as the shareholder of the company, will transfer all its rights to PT Angkasa Pura Indonesia (API) via a sale and purchase agreement, in which API will subsequently exercise all its rights through an inbreng in the form of land covering an area of ~972 thousand square meters valued at ~5.7 trillion rupiah. This corporate action is expected to increase GMFI's equity from a negative position of 249 million US dollars as of June 2025 to a positive 103 million US dollars. After this transaction, API will hold the largest ownership percentage in GMFI, while GIAA's ownership will be diluted. This plan will be discussed at the RUPSLB on October 24, 2025.

tickerNews.title: IDX Halts Trading of Koka Indonesia (KOKA) Due to Controller Commitment Violation
tickerNews.content: The Indonesia Stock Exchange (IDX) decided to temporarily halt the trading of Koka Indonesia ($KOKA) securities in the regular and cash markets starting from the pre-opening session on September 18, 2025. This step was taken by the IDX because the controller of KOKA had violated the commitment to maintain control, as disclosed in the company's prospectus in September 2023. Based on the company's prospectus, Gao Jing as the beneficial owner and controller of the company stated that he would remain the beneficial owner and controller of the company for a period of at least 5 years after the registration statement became effective.
